title: Jay and Elise’s Wedding Party
text: Welcome to our wedding celebration website. It’s high time all our favorite people came to visit us in Madison, Wisconsin to celebrate and have some fun! We are excited to see you at our wedding party on Saturday, October 18, 2025 at the Olin Park Pavilion in town. If you have any questions, please do not hesitate to reach out to us at elise.hinman@gmail.com

title: Jay and Elise’s Wedding Party
text:
Will you join us?
The button below will take you to a Google Form to fill out. Please RSVP by September 1, 2025.   Click here to RSVP



Wisconsin State Capitol

title: Jay and Elise’s Wedding Party
text:
Schedule

Friday, October 17th
7:00 pm to 9:00 pm - Drinks and games at Aftershock Arcade (1444 E Washington Ave Madison, WI 53703). We’ll supply each person with one drink and some arcade tokens!


Saturday, October 18th
5:30 to 9:00 pm - Wedding celebration party at the historic Olin Park Shelter. Arrive for some happy hour drinks before dinner in the pavilion. Be ready for city skyline views, lawn games, music, and more!



Devil’s Lake ferns

title: Jay and Elise’s Wedding Party
text:
Getting Here
Madison has its own quaint airport, Dane County Regional Airport. There are few direct flights to/from Madison, but you might get lucky!
Another option is to fly into Chicago (O’Hare or Midway) and get a rental car. If you fly into O’Hare and do not want to rent a car, you can use the Van Galder bus to get between Madison and Chicago. Bus tickets are around $70 round trip per person.

title: Jay and Elise’s Wedding Party
text:
Lodging
There are a few hotels within a mile of the Olin Park Pavilion.
Holiday Inn Express & Suites Madison Central: 610 John Nolen Drive Madison, Wisconsin 53713
Sheraton Madison Hotel: 706 John Nolen Drive Madison, Wisconsin 53713
Fairfield by Mariott: 722 John Nolen Drive Madison, Wisconsin 53713



Map of nearby hotel locations.


There are also many hotels to choose from on the isthmus (Downtown Madison) and farther outside the city center.

title: Jay and Elise’s Wedding Party
text:
Wedding celebration dress code
Dress code is casual. Please wear clothing that makes you feel good, and make sure you bring layers because early fall in Madison can be a bit variable. We will have yard games set up, so make sure you feel comfortable moving around if you’d like to participate.



Devil’s Lake forest

title: Jay and Elise’s Wedding Party
text:
Things to do
There’s a lot to do around Madison. Here are a few of our favorite spots to eat and hang out. If you find any new spots worth checking out, let us know!

Activities
Olbrich Botanical Gardens - Beautiful outdoor ornamental gardens that are free to the public. Or, if you’re looking for a tropical oasis, check out the Bolz Conservatory (tickets are $6, with free admission on Saturday 10:00 am to 12:00 pm).
University of Wisconsin Madison Arboretum - Sweeping open spaces representing a variety of native Wisconsin plant communities, in addition to curated horticultural collections.
Dane County Farmer’s Market - Expansive farmer’s market featuring Dane County-sourced fruits, vegetables, prepared food, and other wares. Runs from 6:15 am to 1:45 pm on Saturdays.
Northside Farmer’s Market - Sunday farmer’s market near our house! Much smaller, less crowded, delicious breakfast and lunch food.
Henry Vilas Zoo - What can we say, it’s a free-to-visit zoo in a quaint part of town!
Wisconsin State Capitol - Visit the location where we tied the knot: the Wisconsin State Capitol! It is beautiful inside, with gorgeous stonework, mosaics, and other exhibits.
Lakeshore Nature Preserve - An outdoor laboratory for UW Madison, the Lakeshore Nature Preserve has so many lovely views of Lake Mendota and various trails through diverse plant communities.
Wisconsin Memorial Union - The Memorial Union is a gathering place for the community. During pleasant weather, sit out on the Terrace, enjoy a beer, brat, ice cream cone (or all of the above!). It’s a relaxing spot to visit, but beware that parking can be tricky!
Madison Children’s Museum - Arts, crafts, things to climb on, rooftop gardens, and more. We went here with our nephews and had a good time as adults!
Garver Feed Mill - Large, restored brick building containing a collection of shops and places to eat. The Feed Mill often hosts craft fairs and other fun community events.
Monroe Street - Trendy walk with shops, bakeries, and restaurants.
A Room of One’s Own Bookstore - Lovely local bookstore with a diversity of book genres, cards, games, and other gifts.
Explore the neighborhoods - There are so many fun spots to walk and peruse in Madison. This link will take you to a page that explains what different neighborhoods are known for.


Eating
Mint Mark - New American small plates made with locally sourced ingredients. Really good mixed drinks ($$$).
Canteen - Cozy taco joint with delicious margaritas ($$).
Ahan - Amazing Laotian and Asian-inspired dishes with locally sourced ingredients. Like Mint Mark, the drinks are playful and fun to try ($$$).
Bandit Tacos - Tacos and coffee (and margs!) in an old train depot ($$).
Tip Top Tavern - Burgers, sandwiches, salads, and pub appetizers, along with traditional brunch food ($$).
Dexter’s Pub - Fun Wisconsin sports bar with delicious Friday Night Fish Fry ($$).
Molten Monkey - Detroit-style pies with a variety of adventurous flavors ($$).
Lola’s Hi-Lo Lounge - Walk into the doors of Lola’s on the Northside and be transported to another time. It’s like…a chic diner with nightly DJ’s that spin everything from jazz to punk to Motown ($$).
Ancora - Delicious spot for breakfast and lunch, with multiple locations across town ($).
There are so many more, we just don’t have the time or space to list them all.

title: Jay and Elise’s Wedding Party
text:
Backstory
NEWSFLASH: Jay and Elise married on Friday, October 11, 2024 at the Wisconsin State Capitol building, warmly surrounded by our families. It was a beautiful day that included fall color, declarations of love and commitment, lots of laughter, spicy margaritas, and delicious supper club food of course! It could not have been a better day to take this step in our relationship. What better way to draw out the celebration than to have our wedding party the following fall!?



Emmett, Jay, Elise, and Callie
